verses.verse: Boast <S%H1984><s%> not yourself of to morrow <S%H4279><s%>; for you know <S%H3045><s%> not what a day <S%H3117><s%> may bring forth <S%H3205><s%>.
Let another man <S%H2114><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> you <S%H6310><s%>, and not your own mouth; a stranger <S%H5237><s%>, and not your own lips <S%H8193><s%>.
A stone <S%H68><s%> is heavy <S%H3514><s%>, and the sand <S%H2344><s%> weighty <S%H5192><s%>; but a fool <S%H191><s%>'s wrath <S%H3708><s%> is heavier <S%H3515><s%> than them both <S%H8147><s%>.
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is cruel <S%H395><s%>, and anger <S%H639><s%> is outrageous <S%H7858><s%>; but who is able to stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> envy <S%H7068><s%>?
Open <S%H1540><s%> rebuke <S%H8433><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than secret <S%H5641><s%> love <S%H160><s%>.
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the wounds <S%H6482><s%> of a friend <S%H157><s%>; but the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of a enemy <S%H8130><s%> are deceitful <S%H6280><s%>.
The full <S%H7649><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> loathes <S%H947><s%> a honeycomb <S%H5317><s%>; but to the hungry <S%H7457><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> every bitter thing <S%H4751><s%> is sweet <S%H4966><s%>.
As a bird <S%H6833><s%> that wanders <S%H5074><s%> from her nest <S%H7064><s%>, so is a man <S%H376><s%> that wanders <S%H5074><s%> from his place <S%H4725><s%>.

Ointment <S%H8081><s%> and perfume <S%H7004><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%>: so does the sweetness <S%H4986><s%> of a man <S%H7453><s%>'s friend by hearty <S%H5315><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%>.

Your own friend <S%H7453><s%>, and your father <S%H1><s%>'s friend <S%H7453><s%>, forsake <S%H5800><s%> not <S%H935><s%>; neither go into your brother <S%H251><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of your calamity <S%H343><s%>: for better <S%H2896><s%> is a neighbor <S%H7934><s%> that is near <S%H7138><s%> than a brother <S%H251><s%> far off <S%H7350><s%>.
My son <S%H1121><s%>, be wise <S%H2449><s%>, and make my heart <S%H3820><s%> glad <S%H8055><s%>, that I may answer <S%H7725><s%> him that blasphemes me <S%H2778><s%>.
A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man foresees <S%H7200><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%>, and hides <S%H5641><s%> himself <S%H6612><s%>; but the simple pass on <S%H5674><s%>, and are punished <S%H6064><s%>.
Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> that is collateral <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger <S%H2114><s%>, and take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of him for a strange woman <S%H5237><s%>.

He that blesses <S%H1288><s%> his friend <S%H7453><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%>, rising early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, it shall be counted <S%H2803><s%> a curse to him <S%H7045><s%>.
A continual <S%H2956><s%> dropping <S%H1812><s%> in a very rainy <S%H5464><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> and a contentious <S%H4079><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> are alike <S%H7737><s%>.
Whoever hides <S%H6845><s%> her hides <S%H6845><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>, and the ointment <S%H8081><s%> of his right hand <S%H3225><s%>, which betrays itself <S%H7121><s%>.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> sharpens <S%H2300><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%>; so a man <S%H376><s%> sharpens <S%H2300><s%> the favor <S%H6440><s%> of his friend <S%H7453><s%>.
Whoever keeps <S%H5341><s%> the fig tree <S%H8384><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> there <S%H8104><s%>: so he that waits on his master <S%H113><s%> shall be honored <S%H3513><s%>.
As in water <S%H4325><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> answers to face <S%H6440><s%>, so the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> to man <S%H120><s%>.
Hell <S%H7585><s%> and destruction <S%H11><s%> are never <S%H3808><s%> full <S%H7646><s%>; so the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> are never satisfied <S%H7646><s%>.
As the refining pot <S%H4715><s%> for silver <S%H3701><s%>, and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold <S%H2091><s%>; so is a man <S%H376><s%> to <S%H6310><s%> his praise <S%H4110><s%>.

Though you should pound <S%H3806><s%> a fool <S%H191><s%> in a mortar <S%H4388><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> wheat <S%H7383><s%> with a pestle <S%H5940><s%>, yet will not his foolishness <S%H200><s%> depart from him <S%H5493><s%>.
Be you diligent <S%H3045><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> the state <S%H6440><s%> of your flocks <S%H6629><s%>, and look <S%H7896><s%> well <S%H3820><s%> to your herds <S%H5739><s%>.
For riches <S%H2633><s%> are not for ever <S%H5769><s%>: and does the crown <S%H5145><s%> endure to every <S%H1755><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%>?
The hay <S%H2682><s%> appears <S%H1540><s%>, and the tender grass <S%H1877><s%> shows <S%H7200><s%> itself <S%H6212><s%>, and herbs of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> are gathered <S%H622><s%>.
The lambs <S%H3532><s%> are for your clothing <S%H3830><s%>, and the goats <S%H6260><s%> are the price <S%H4242><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>.

And you shall have goats <S%H5795><s%>' milk <S%H2461><s%> enough <S%H1767><s%> for your food <S%H3899><s%>, for the food <S%H3899><s%> of your household <S%H1004><s%>, and for the maintenance <S%H2416><s%> for your maidens <S%H5291><s%>.
